title.native: 進撃の巨人 隔絶都市の女王
title.romaji: Shingeki no Kyojin: Kakuzetsu Toshi no Joou
title.english: Attack on Titan: The Harsh Mistress of the City

description:
With Wall Maria breached, communities within the Quinta district have been cut off from each other creating famine and chaos. A young field commander named Rita is tasked with a mission to reconnect transit across the massive district while putting her troops and residence right in the vanguard as Titans descend on her town.

(Source: Kodansha USA)
synonyms: Attack on Titan: The Queen of the Isolated City
L'Attaque des Titans - Hope of the City

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Delinquents
tags.description: Features characters with a notorious image and attitude, sometimes referred to as "yankees".

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Fugitive
tags.description: Prominently features a character evading capture by an individual or organization.

tags.name: Kingdom Management
tags.description: Characters in these series take on the responsibility of running a town or kingdom, whether they take control of an existing one, or build their own from the ground up.

tags.name: Medieval
tags.description: Partially or completely set in the Middle Ages or a Middle Ages-inspired setting. Commonly features elements such as European castles and knights.

name.native: マティアス・クラマー

node.description:
__Doujin Circle:__ PASTA'S ESTAB.

[Website](https://www.pseweb.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Murata_Range)

Renji "Range" Murata is a Japanese artist and designer, known for his unique style combining Art Deco and Japanese Anime elements. He is best known for his conceptual design work on [Last Exile](https://anilist.co/anime/97/Last-Exile/) and [Blue Submarine No. 6](https://anilist.co/anime/1051/Blue-Submarine-No-6/).

He began his career in the early 1990s doing design work for video games, including having done the illustrations and character design for the fighting game series made by Atlus, *Power Instinct (豪血寺一族, Goketsuji Ichizoku)*. Since 1996 he left the game company and went on to become a freelance illustrator.

He runs a doujin circle called *PASTA'S ESTAB.*, which publishes collections of illustrations from his various works as well as some original goods. He has published more than a dozen books of his work, some of the most notable being *Robot*, *Rule*, and *futurhythm*. He was also voted "Best Artist of the Year" in the 2006 Seiun Award.

Since 2013 Murata has served as a faculty member at the Kyoto Seika University's Faculty of Manga(Character Design Course). Artist [You Shiina](https://anilist.co/staff/105062/You-Shiina) is said to be among his students.

Range Murata selected an elite army of artists including [Yoshitoshi ABe](https://anilist.co/staff/96991/Yoshitoshi-ABe) and [Ugetsu Hakua](https://anilist.co/staff/102066/Ugetsu-Hakua) to contribute to *ROBOT* Volume 1 and ongoing.

**Notable works outside anime:**
~!
- Power Instinct (Arcade, 1993) (Back Designer) | (SNES, 1994) (Ending Design) *As Range
- Power Instinct 2 (Arcade, 1994) (Scroll Design) *As Range
- Tengai (SEGA Saturn, 1996) (Guest Illustrator)
- Groove on Fight: Gōketsuji Ichizoku 3 (Arcade, 1997) (Designer) *As Range
- Wachenröder (SEGA Saturn, 1998) (Main Character Design)
- Blue Submarine No. 6: Saigetsu Fumahito - Time and Tide (Dreamcast, 2000) (Character Design)
- Shin Gōketsuji Ichizoku Tōkon: Matrimelee (Arcade/Neo Geo, 2003) (Illustration)
- Spy Fiction (PlayStation 2, 2003) (Character Designer)
- Shin Gōketsuji Ichizoku: Bonnō no Kaihō (PlayStation 2, 2006) (Illustration)
- Gōketsuji Ichizoku: Senzo Kuyō (Arcade, 2009) (Illustration) !~

[Official Blog](http://blog.livedoor.jp/isayamahazime/) After graduating from Oita Prefectural Hitarinkou High School, he matriculated in the cartoon design program of the cartoon arts department at Kyushu Designer Gakuin. After graduating, he moved to Tokyo and started drawing his manga works. In 2006, he applied for the Magazine Grand Prix known as MGP promoted by Kodansha Ltd. and his work [Attack on Titan](https://anilist.co/manga/85420/Attack-on-Titan-Volume-0/) was given the "Fine Work" award. Originally, he offered his work to the Weekly Shonen Jump department at Shueisha, where he was advised to modify his style and story to be more suitable for Weekly Shonen Jump. He declined and instead, decided to take it to the Weekly Shonen Magazine department at Kodansha Ltd. In 2008, he applied for the 80th Weekly Shonen Magazine Freshman Manga Award, where his work ["Heart Break One"]( was given the Special Encouragement Award. His other work "orz" was chosen as a selected work in the 81st Weekly Shonen Magazine Freshman Manga Award. In 2009, his first serialized work _[Attack on Titan](https://anilist.co/manga/53390/Attack-on-Titan/)_ appeared in Bessatsu Shonen Magazine, a monthly magazine. It later was awarded the Shonen category of the 35th Kodansha Manga Award in 2011.
